Class AbstractStringValidator<T>

java.lang.Object
  org.aavso.tools.vstar.data.validation.AbstractStringValidator<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
CommentCodeValidator, CommonTextFormatValidator, JulianDayValidator, MagnitudeFieldValidator, MagnitudeValueValidator, MTypeValidator, ObserverCodeValidator, OptionalityFieldValidator, RegexValidator, TransformedValidator, ValflagValidator
public abstract class AbstractStringValidator<T>
extends java.lang.Object

This is the base class for all string-based validators.

isLegallyEmpty

protected boolean isLegallyEmpty(java.lang.String str)
                          throws ObservationValidationError
Is the supplied string legally empty or null?

Parameters:
str - The string to be validated.
Returns:
True if the string is allowed to be empty and is empty or null, and False if the string is allowed to be empty but is NOT empty or null.
Throws:
ObservationValidationError - if the string is empty or null but canBeEmpty() returns false.

canBeEmpty

protected boolean canBeEmpty()
Can the string to be validated by this class be empty? Defaults to false.

Returns:
True or False
